body.p: The boards also observed that this criterion is not intended to apply to contracts in which the entity’s performance is not immediately consumed by the customer, which would be typical in cases in which the entity’s performance results in an asset (such as work‑in‑progress). Consequently, an entity that applies IFRS 15 to contracts in which the entity’s performance results in an asset (which could be intangible) being created or enhanced should consider the criteria in paragraph 35(b) and (c) of IFRS 15.
